Let $ BC$ of right triangle $ ABC$ be the diameter of a circle intersecting hypotenuse $ AB$ in $ D$.  At $ D$ a tangent is drawn cutting leg $ CA$ in $ F$.  This information is <u>not</u> sufficient to prove that\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ DF \text{ bisects }CA \qquad \textbf{(B)}\ DF \text{ bisects }\angle CDA$\\
$ \textbf{(C)}\ DF = FA \qquad \textbf{(D)}\ \angle A = \angle BCD \qquad \textbf{(E)}\ \angle CFD = 2\angle A$
